meanings.definition: The top layer of the earth's surface in which plants grow.
meanings.sent1: The soil was rich and dark, perfect for growing vegetables.
meanings.sent2: Farmers plant seeds in the soil to help crops grow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel buried its acorns deep in the soil, playing a secret game.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening had taken root in the soil of her childhood home.
meanings.sent5: The soil smelled fresh after the rain, promising new life.

meanings.sent1: Please don't soil your clothes while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The muddy puddles on the road can soil your shoes.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy managed to soil the clean carpet with its muddy paws.
meanings.sent4: His reputation was soiled by the false accusations.
meanings.sent5: The spilled juice threatened to soil the white tablecloth.

meanings.sent1: Be careful not to soil the white shirt with spaghetti sauce.
meanings.sent2: The ink from the pen accidentally soiled the important document.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to soil his sister's painting with his fingerprints.
meanings.sent4: The scandal threatened to soil the politician's career.
meanings.sent5: The gossip would soil her reputation if it spread further.
